intro: Besleria nubigena, commonly known as the cloud forest begonia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and thrives in well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Its foliage is often broad and glossy, contributing to its ornamental value in botanical gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
